intro: Limonium ilvae, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which help it thrive in saline and sandy environments. The plant belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its ability to tolerate drought and high salt content in the soil. Limonium ilvae typically grows in low, compact mounds, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its flowers bloom in summer, adding a vibrant touch to coastal landscapes.
